sanskrit_verse:
यतश्च भयमाशङ्केत्ततो विस्तारयेद्बलम् ।
पद्मेन चैव व्यूहेन निविशेत सदा स्वयम् ॥ ७.१८८॥
transliteration:
yataśca bhayamāśaṅkettato vistārayedbalam |
padmena caiva vyūhena niviśeta sadā svayam || 7.188||
sph_interpretive_translation: Where fear arises, there one must expand strength; through the arrangement of the lotus formation, one must always establish oneself.
jurisprudential_principles: Fear is a signal for capacity activation
Strength expansion aligns with inner structural order
Restoration occurs through ordered energetic deployment
executable_legal_axioms: IF fear is detected in actor THEN initiate strength-deployment protocol
IF threat vector identified THEN activate padma-vyuha stabilization matrix
IF jurisdictional instability observed THEN reassert svayam-location mechanism
IF capacity underutilization noted THEN trigger vistara-bala enhancement process
IF dharma-adhikari reports imbalance THEN deploy lotus-array consciousness structuring
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, when existential or systemic threats arise, the presiding adhikari must not retreat into reactive frameworks but deploy expanded constitutional strength through structured consciousness arrangements. The court's authority is re-established via padma-vyuha alignment—ensuring that justice emanates from centered svayam-sthiti rather than external coercion.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana reveals fear as indicative of displaced awareness, not guilt. Anupurvasah shows sequential dislocation leading to perceived threat. Responsibility lies in reactivating innate strength, not punishing perceived failure. Nyaya operates by restoring causal alignment through self-reinforcing consciousness structures.
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Fear is dissolved through strength expansion, not suppression. Dharma is restored through conscious self-alignment. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
